docs.snippet: A WATERSHED in the national campaign against pay toilets was reached this month when legislation banning such facilities was  passed in New York State. Leaders of the campaign, however, viewed it as only a start toward dealing with a much larger p...
docs.lead_paragraph: A WATERSHED in the national campaign against pay toilets was reached this month when legislation banning such facilities was passed in New York State. Leaders of the campaign, however, viewed it as only a start toward dealing with a much larger problem--the lack of public restroom facilities in the country as a whole.
docs.abstract: Leaders of campaign against pay toilets view campaign as start in dealing with problem of lack of public restroom facilities in US; lack is seen as problem during Bicentennial; 16-million people visit Times Sq, NYC, annually and only nearby public restroom is in basement of Nathan's restaurant; in Phila's Independence Natl Historical Park, where 10-million visitors are expected, restroom facilities are minimal; lack of public restrooms in tourist areas of Washington, DC, noted (M)

headline.main: Notes: The Campaign To Ban Pay Toilets; Notes About Travel Notes About Travel.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 1 -- Procedures governing the issuance of entry and quota visas under the system established by the State Department for the control of persons entering and leaving the United States, will be brought up before the House of Delega...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 1 -- Procedures governing the issuance of entry and quota visas under the system established by the State Department for the control of persons entering and leaving the United States, will be brought up before the House of Delegates of the American Bar Association at its midwinter meeting opening tomorrow in Chicago, for appraisal and criticism.
docs.abstract: Amer Bar Assn House of Delegates to protest rule requiring attys to state fee expected from U S entry and visa applicants; other recommendations to be urged by assn discussed; Interdepartmental Rev Comm duties discussed

headline.main: LAWYERS PROTEST VISA PROCEDURES; Rule Requiring Attorney to State Fee He Will Get From Applicant Is Opposed OTHER CHANGES SOUGHT End to Ban on Counsel at Primary Hearing Is Asked -- Questions Before Bar Group

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 2 -- Brazil may deny passport visas to Axis diplomats wishing to go to Argentina or Chile, it was learned today. There was no indication as to whether Argentina had suggested such action, or whether the plan was Brazil...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 2 -- Brazil may deny passport visas to Axis diplomats wishing to go to Argentina or Chile, it was learned today. There was no indication as to whether Argentina had suggested such action, or whether the plan was Brazil's.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 15 -- If you travel to other cities to visit friends, if you go home for the week-end to visit your family when you are working in a distant city, take a train trip to see the sights, attend a theatre or a race track, if you trave...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 15 -- If you travel to other cities to visit friends, if you go home for the week-end to visit your family when you are working in a distant city, take a train trip to see the sights, attend a theatre or a race track, if you travel for pleasure alone you are doing something nonessential which will hinder movement of troops and the war effort in general.
docs.abstract: ODT renews plea to limit trips; lists rules

headline.main: ODT RENEWS PLEA TO LIMIT TRAVEL; Repeats Rules, at Request of OWI, to Guide Public on Ban of Nonessential Trips OPPOSES SPLIT VACATIONS Journeys for Annual Rest Are Set at Simple Round Trips With No Side Excursions

docs.snippet: LONDON, June 10 -- Konni Zilliacus, member of Parliament, whose expulsion from the Labor party was confirmed this week by the annual party conference, published today an appeal he and Pierre Cot, member of the French National Assembly, have sent t...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, June 10 -- Konni Zilliacus, member of Parliament, whose expulsion from the Labor party was confirmed this week by the annual party conference, published today an appeal he and Pierre Cot, member of the French National Assembly, have sent to President Truman to rescind the ban against their entering the United States.
docs.abstract: K Zilllacus and P Cot lr to Pres Truman urges ban on their entry be lifted

headline.main: ZILLIACUS IN TRUMAN PLEA; Ousted British Laborite Appeals for End Ban on U. S. Entry
